alert.note: Alert for Berks; Carbon; Eastern Chester; Eastern Montgomery; Lehigh; Lower Bucks; Monroe; Northampton; Upper Bucks; Western Chester; Western Montgomery (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 25 at 10:44AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Gusty showers will impact portions of northwestern Hunterdon, west central Sussex, Warren, eastern Berks, Lehigh, Montgomery, southeastern Carbon, northwestern Bucks, northeastern Chester, southern Monroe and Northampton Counties through 1115 AM EDT... At 1039 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking gusty showers along a line extending from Beltzville State Park to Leesport to near Coatesville. Weather stations measured wind gusts up to 40 mph. Movement was northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Observed. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Allentown, Reading, Easton, Bethlehem, Norristown, Pottstown, Phoenixville, Lansdale, West Norriton, Forks, East Norriton, Coatesville, Emmaus, Wyomissing, Northampton, East Stroudsburg, Quakertown, Perkasie, Doylestown and Wilson. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 296 and 334. Northeast Extension between mile markers 21 and 72. Interstate 76 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 327 and 328. Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 38 and 76. Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 11. Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 306 and 314. Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 13. Interstate 176 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 1 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Berks; Carbon; Eastern Chester; Eastern Montgomery; Lehigh; Lower Bucks; Monroe; Northampton; Upper Bucks; Western Chester; Western Montgomery
